title: Protocol to establish a stable MLL-AF9_AML mouse model
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Retroviral particle production and mouse hematopoietic stem/progenitor cell (mHSPC) spinoculation
Timing: 10 day
The aim of this session is to produce retroviral particles encoding MLL-AF9 oncogenic gene fusion, and infect mHSPCs isolated from CD45.1+ donor mice with this retrovirus.
Day 0: Seed HEK293T cells in 60 mm culture dishes at 0.5 × 106 cells per dish in 5 mL HEK293T medium, and culture the cells in 37°C, 5% CO2 incubator.
Cells are counted as follows: Add 20 μL cell suspension into a 1.5 mL tube. Mix well with 20 μL 0.4% trypan blue solution.
Take out 20 μL of the mixture and add the mixture into the cell counting plate. Place the cell counting plate into the Countstar Automated cell counter and count the cell number.
Note: 1 × 106 HEK293T cells will be needed for virus producing purpose for 1 × 106 bone marrow (BM) progenitor cells of one infection group.
Day 1: Transfect HEK293T cells.
Change the medium of HEK293T cells with 4 mL fresh HEK293T medium before transfection.
Prepare two 1.5 mL centrifuge tubes, label the tubes with Tube 1 and Tube 2, and then add 250 μL Opti-MEM per tube.
Add plasmid and Lipofectamine™ 2000 into each tube according to the list below:
table:files/protocols_protocol_1845_8.csv
Mix each tube gently and incubate for 5 min at 24°C.
Combine tube 2 with tube 1, mix slightly and incubate the mixture for 20 min at 24°C.
Add the transfection mixture into HEK293T cells and culture the cells at a 37°C, 5% CO2 incubator.
Note: To obtain higher transfection efficiency, the ideal density of HEK293T cells is of 50%–60% confluence and well adherent.
Day 2: Insolate BM progenitor cells.

Change medium of transfected HEK293T cells with 4 mL fresh HEK293T medium and 1.0 mM sodium pyruvate early in the morning.
Euthanize donor mice. Disinfect the mice with 70% ethanol. Dissect the tibia and the femur of both rear arms, remove the muscles, adipose and disconnect the joints as much as possible (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/1845-Fig1.jpg
Figure 1. Preparation of an instant mouse fixation and operation board
(A) Wrap the foam board with aluminum foil.
(B) Cover the aluminum foil with 3 layers of paper towels. And then euthanized mouse can be fixed on top of the board for further operations.
Put the bones into a 60 mm tissue dish containing 4 mL fresh BM washing medium. Flush BM cells into a new 60 mm tissue dish with 3 mL BM washing medium by use of a 3 mL syringe with 25 G 1 1/2 inch needle (Figures 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]A and 2B).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/1845-Fig2.jpg
Figure 2. Harvest the bone marrow (BM) cells
(A) Dissect the tibias and femurs into a 60 mm tissue culture dish with 4 mL fresh BM washing buffer.
(B) Flush the BM cells.
(C and D) Filter the cell suspension through a 40 μm cell strainer.
Eliminate cell debris and clumps by filtering the cell suspension with a 40 μm cell strainer, and collect the flow-through into a 50 mL centrifuge tube (Figures 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]C and 2D). Wash the cell strainer with 1 mL BM washing medium.
Spin down at 400 g for 8 min at 4°C.
Aspirate the supernatant and resuspend the cell pellets with 20 mL ACK lysis buffer at 4°C for 8 min to remove the red blood cells lysis.
Spin down at 400 g for 8 min at 4°C. Discard the supernatant and add 5 mL MCs buffer to resuspend the cell pellets.
Count cell numbers.

Centrifuge cells at 400 g for 8 min. Aspirate the supernatant.
Use Lineage Cell Depletion Kit for magnetic labeling according to the manufacturer’s protocol[href=https://www.miltenyibiotec.com/CN-en/products/lineage-cell-depletion-kit-mouse.html]. Add 40 μL MCs buffer per 107 total cells to resuspend the cell pellets.
Add 10 μL Biotin-Antibody Cocktail per 107 cells and mix well. Incubate at 4°C for 10 min.
Add 30 μL MCs buffer and 20 μL Anti-Biotin MicroBeads per 107 total cells and mix well. Incubate at 4°C for 15 min.
Add 1 mL MCs buffer per 107 total cells to wash the cells. Spin down at 300 g for 10 min.
Aspirate the supernatant and add 500 μL MCs buffer per 5 × 107 total cells to resuspend the cell pellets.
Place the separation column in a MACS separator device. Rinse the separation column with 500 μL MCs buffer. Transfer the cell suspension to separation column and collect the pass-through.
Wash the separation column with 500 μL MCs buffer for three times.
Count the enriched progenitor cells. Centrifuge cells at 400 g for 8 min and discard the supernatant. Resuspend the cell pellets at a density of 1–5 × 106 cells/mL with progenitor cell culture medium. Culture the cells at 37°C, 5% CO2 incubator.
Note: According to the instruction, the maximum volume of a MS column is 500 μL. According to our experiences, it is expected that one 5-FU injected healthy donor yields 2.5–3.5 × 106 BM cells. Other groups also reported the expected yields were around 3.04 ± 0.79×106 four days after 150 mg/kg 5-FU treatment. (Shaikh et al., 2016[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib4]).
Day 3: Infect BM progenitor cells.
Pre-warm the centrifuge at 30°C.
Critical: It is important to keep the temperature consistently at 30°C to ensure the transfection efficiency and cell survival.

Collect the retrovirus and filter the virus medium with a 22 μm cell strainer into a 15 mL centrifuge tube. Change medium as the same as Day 2 for HEK293T cells.
Add the 3.2 mL filtered retrovirus into one well of 6 well plates. Add 800 μL cell suspension into the virus soup.
Add 4 μg/mL polybrene into the wells.
Centrifuge cells at 550 g, 30°C for 3 h.
Incubate the cells at 37°C, 5% CO2 incubator for 1 h.
Collect the BM cells into a 15 mL centrifuge tube and centrifuge at 400 g for 8 min.
Aspirate the supernatant and resuspend the cell pellets with 4 mL progenitor cell culture medium.
Day 4: Repeat the procedure as Day 3 to infect BM progenitor cells again.
From Day 5–10: Add 50 mg/mL G418 into each well of the cell culture plate.
Critical: Take care of progenitor cells; record cell numbers and viability every other day if necessary and keep cell density at 1–5× 106 cells/ml.
1st BMT
Timing: 1 day
In this session, transfected primary donor cells are transplanted into primary recipient mice to trigger primary AML.
Irradiate C57BL/6 (CD45.2) recipient mice at 960 rads in the morning.
Prepare donor cells for BM transplantation.
Sacrifice one CD45.2 mouse (not irradiated) as helper and collect its BM cells according to the above procedure.
Harvest transfected BM progenitor cells and filter the cell suspension with a 40 μm cell strainer into a 50 mL centrifuge tube to remove cell clumps.
Count cell number and take out appropriate cells as BMT donor cells. Keep these cells in another 50 mL centrifuge tube.
Add 1 × 106 helper cells per recipient mouse into collection tube containing donor cells.
Centrifuge the cells mixture at 400 g for 8 min.

Remove the supernatant and resuspend the cell pellets with 1 × PBS.
Centrifuge cells at 400 g for 8 min.
Discard the supernatant. Add appropriate amount of 1 × PBS (100 μL per recipient mouse) into the cell pellets.
Transplant donor cells into recipient mice via tail vein injection.
Pre-warm the recipient mice adequately with a warm lamp, for about 10–15 min, to dilate blood vessels prior to injection.
Use a 1 mL syringe and a 25 G 1 inch needle to mix the cell.
Change the needle with a 27 G 0.5 inch one and inject 100 μL of the cell suspension per mouse through tail veins.
Feed recipient mice with antibiotic-containing water.
Note: Pay attention to the health condition of the irradiated mice. If necessary, give some auxiliary care, e.g., water gel, soft food, etc., in the first one or two weeks after BMT.
Tissue sample collection from leukemia mice
Timing: 1 day
In this session, BM cells from the primary leukemic recipient mice are collected.
Harvest the BM cells and spleen according to the procedure 3b-i when the recipient mice are meeting the endpoints.
Optional: Harvest the blood, liver and spleen according to your experimental purposes (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]).
Prepare 0.1–0.2 × 106 1st BMT recipient mice’ BM cells as donor cells for each 2nd recipient mouse in 2nd BMT.

(A) WBC counts of MLL-AF9_AML mice at the endpoints of 2nd BMT.
(B) Spleen weights of non-treated C57BL/6 mice, and leukemic recipient mice after 1st BMT or 2nd BMT.
(C) Spleen images of a non-treated C57BL/6 mouse and a MLL-AF9_AML mouse. Mean ± SEM, ∗∗∗p<0.001, two-tailed t-test.

Note: Since engraftment (i.e., CD45.1+ population) of 1st BMT recipients at the end point is usually above 85% (Figure 4[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig4]), these BM cells (i.e., 2nd BMT donor cells) are considered to be leukemic cells with malignant expansion, and can be used as 2nd BMT donor cells directly. If the primary recipients’ final engraftment is below 85%, purify the leukemic cells through flow cytometry isolation (see step 20 for details).
Freeze remaining cells in liquid nitrogen with frozen stock solution.
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/1845-Fig4.jpg
Figure 4. Flow analysis showing the engraftment of CD45.1+ cells in BM of non-treated C57BL/6 mice, 1st BMT or 2nd BMT recipient mice at the endpoints
Pause point: Cells can be stored in liquid nitrogen for several months.
2nd BMT
Timing: 20–40 days
In this session, AML cells collected from the primary leukemic recipients are transplanted as donor cells into secondary recipient mice to trigger 2nd leukemia.
Collect the BM cells from primary BMT leukemic mice according to the procedure shown above when the mice reach the endpoints. Freeze 5 × 106 cells per tube in liquid nitrogen with frozen stock solution.
Thaw one vial of primary BMT leukemic mice BM cells one day before 2nd transplantation as the 2nd BMT donor cells.
Irradiate C57BL/6 (CD45.2) mice as 2nd BMT recipients at 480 rads in the morning.
Prepare 2nd BMT donor cells (0.1–0.2 × 106 cells per mouse) according to the procedure 8 b-c and e-h.
Inject donor cells into tail veins according to the procedure 9.
Monitor the engraftment of donor cells in recipient mice, and monitor leukemia pathogenesis by collecting peripheral blood (PB) and measuring the percentage of CD45.1+ cell via flow cytometry.
Restrict a mouse manually or using a mouse restainer for blood collection.
Aseptically prepare the tail with 70% ethanol.

Nick the tail with a sterile scalpel blade on a lateral side.
Collect 50 μL blood in a 0.5 mL MiniCollect tube.
Press the tail to stop bleeding and return the mouse into the cage.
Use 1 mL ACK lysis buffer to lyse the red blood cells and move the lysis in to a new 1.5 mL tube. Incubate at 4°C for 8 min.
Spin down at 400 g for 8 min at 4°C and remove the lysis.
Use 1 mL ACK lysis buffer to resuspend cell pellets. Repeat the incubation and centrifugation.
Use 1 mL ice-cold 1 × PBS to resuspend cell pellets and spin down at 400 g for 8 min at 4°C. Remove the supernatant.
Sample preparation and detection for flow cytometry according to the steps 20b–g.
Pause point: Fixed flow cytometry samples can be stored in 4°C for 2–3 days before testing.
Optional: Drug administration or other manipulation can be carried out in this period.
Pathological sample collection and pathogenesis monitoring
Timing: 1 day
In this session, AML pathogenesis after each BMT is monitored through flow cytometry analysis.
Collect PB from heart into 0.5 mL MiniCollect tube by a 1 mL syringe with 27 G 0.5 inch needle and test WBC (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]A). Harvest the BM cells and weigh the liver and spleen of leukemia mice (Figures 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]B and 3C).
Optional: Collect liver and spleen tissues, perform paraffin embedding, slide cutting and H&E staining, to investigate leukemic cell infiltration condition. Observe cell morphology with cytospin specimens of BM cells.
Detecting leukemic cell engraftment and differentiation through BM cells and flow cytometry analysis.
Collect 1 × 106 leukemia mice BM cells and wash with ice cold 1 × PBS.
Add 30 μL BD staining buffer and 0.3 μL Human TruStain FcXTM to resuspend the cell pellets.

Blend the cells by flicking and stay at 24°C for 10 min.
For the leukemic cell engraftment test, add 0.5 μL anti-mouse CD45.1- PE-Cyanine5.5 into TruStain FcXTM blocking cells. Stain cell samples with anti-mouse CD11b-Super Bright 600 and anti-mouse Gr-1- PE-Cyanine5 antibodies for cell differentiation test. Keep a blank control without adding any antibodies or simple IgG.
Incubate at 4°C for 25 min. Avoid light.
Add 1 mL ice cold 1 × PBS to wash away excess antibodies. Centrifuge cells at 400 g for 8 min.
Discard the supernatant and resuspend the cell pellets with 400 μL IC Fixation Buffer and then load for flow cytometry analysis on BD FACSAria III.
Pause point: Fixed flow cytometry samples can be stored in 4°C for 2–3 days before testing.
